div.l: He yexeth and he speketh þurgh the nose
As he were in the quakke or in the pose
To bedde he goth and with hym goth his wyfe
As any Iay he lyght was and Iolyf
So was his iolyf whistell wele I wette
The cradell at hir beddes fete is y sette
To rokken ⁊and to ȝif the child souke
And whan that dronken was all in the crouke
To bedde went the doghter ryght anoone
To bedde goth Alen̄ and also Iohn
Ther was no more hem nedith no dwale
This myller haith so wysely bybbed the ale
That as an hors he snortyth in his slepe
Ne of his taile behynd he toke no kepe
His wyf bare hym a burdon̄ a full strong
Men myght hir rovtyng here a forlong
The wenche routeth eke ꝑpar companye
Alen̄ the clerk that herd this melodie
He powked Iohn and seyd slepest þow
Herde þow eủer swilke a sange or now
Loo swilke a coupleyng is betwyx hem alle
A wilde fire on ther bodies falle
Who herd euer swilk a ferly thynge
Ȝei thei shall haue the floure of euyll endyng
This lange nyght ther tydes me na rest
But ȝet na fors all shall be for the best
For Iohn seyd as euery mote I thryfe
Yf that I may yond wenche wyll I swyfe
Som esement hath lawe shapen vs
For Iohn ther is a lawe that seith thus
That yf a man̄ in oo poynt be a greved
That in an other he shall be releved
Oure corn is stollen̄ sothely hit is no nay
